title: User manual - ovscout2
text: ovscout2 free, open-source R/Shiny app scouting volleyball matches. provides industry-standard dvw files can used openvolley suite R packages, volleyball analytics software takes dvw files inputs. app requires video match fixed view point (.e. camera move duration match). videos usually taken “scout viewpoint” — behind one end court, reasonable height entire court clearly visible players court tend occlude . app writen R, necessarily need R user able use . provide script files launch app command line (although need install R platforms, see ). R user, see “Standalone” section installation startup.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: need online installation. app initially needs download install additional R packages (quite , fact). app installed run , can used offline thereafter necessary. Also see “system utilities” section, .

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: standalone installer allows run app without anything R.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Download ovscout2-win-x64.zip file unzip convenient location. Run ov_scouter.bat ov_scouter_demo.bat file. first run take quite time, install number additional R packages. Subsequent startups much faster (checks updates startup, might reinstall packages occasion).

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Install R, following https://cran.r-project.org/ Download ovscout2-unix-x64.zip file unzip convenient location. Run ov_scouter ov_scouter_demo script. first run take quite time, install number additional R packages. Subsequent startups much faster (checks updates startup, might reinstall packages occasion). Note: tested Mac.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Install R, optionally RStudio. R:

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Three system utilities recommended required. Note standalone Windows bundle already includes utilities — action needed case. ffmpeg used extract frames videos, video-related functions. ffmpeg available, internal fallback method used functionality, may considerably slower. Install ffmpeg via package manager, (within R, Linux Windows ) using ovideo::ov_install_ffmpeg() lighttpd lightweight web server used play match video. Install (within R, Windows ) using ovscout2::ov_install_lighttpd() manually http://lighttpd.dtech.hu/ (Windows) via package manager operating systems (see https://redmine.lighttpd.net/projects/lighttpd/wiki/GetLighttpd). lighttpd installed, app falls back built-web server little slower less responsive lighttpd. pandoc required generating match reports scouted files. Install following https://github.com/jgm/pandoc/blob/master/INSTALL.md. present, report generation menu item won’t shown.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: startup options regardless whether using standalone version starting app within R: “season directory” folder containing dvw files matches. scouting new match provide season directory, can choose teams matches new match. saves re-enter team player details. season directory also used starting point selecting video file video file required can also optionally provide .dvw .ovs file (.e. partially-scouted file wish continue scouting). provide dvw file, app creates new, empty match file.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Run ov_scouter.bat (Windows) ov_scouter (Linux/Mac) script. prompt season directory, dvw file, video file. season directory dvw file optional (new match file created dvw provided) video required. Options controlling app behaviour scouting preferences can changed via “Preferences” button app.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: session first need load ovscout2 package: start app. can start arguments: … prompt (standalone version) season directory, dvw file, video file. season directory dvw file optional (new match file created dvw provided) video required. can optionally provide arguments explicitly. start new match certain video file, using teams already-scouted matches season directory, : already partially-scouted match saved file, can re-start scouting: (case need provide video file path, saved within .ovs file.) several options can provided ov_scouter() function, including: auto_save_dir directory scouted file saved (.dvw format) rally. can use e.g. provide live updates coaching bench scoreboard - show scoreboard top right-hand corner video screen (true default) ball_path - show ball path court diagram (false default, slows app little) review_pane - show video review pane data entry popup (true default) playlist_display_option - show plays table? Either “dv_codes” (scouted codes) “commentary” (plain-language interpretation touches) shortcuts - named list defines keyboard shortcuts used app scouting_options, default_scouting_table, compound_table - advanced options controlling details scouting process Options controlling app behaviour scouting preferences can changed via “Preferences” button app.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: number preferences can set, either via “Preferences” button app (starting app within R) via ov_scouting_options arguments ov_scouter function. Preferences include: “End convention” determines whether treating end coordinate attack serve actual end location (.e. ball contacted floor bounds area), intended end location. actual might differ intended block touch ball hit net. ‘actual’, block touch recorded, end location attack used dig location (dig location missing). “Record sets transition”. FALSE, sets transition scouted. entering attack end location (play continues) next click counterattack start location, set scouted .

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: scout new match, start app corresponding video file, : Define court reference via “Court reference” button. requires click four corners court video image, app can map clicks video real-world court coordinates Enter match details via “Edit match data” button (match date, venue, scout name, etc) Define teams playing match. provided season directory (existing .dvw .ovs files ) can choose teams files. Otherwise can enter new teams Enter team lineups set 1, including libero(s) team. two liberos entered, app assume first libero court serve reception (.e. “passing” libero) second libero court serving (“defending” libero). team two liberos one takes court per set, just enter libero actually going play set

text: scouting process guided one. contact marked clicking video time point contact, point contact point floor directly ball played. often player’s feet dig set ball, jumping spike.

text: checking orientation court diagram (top right) matches video. Swap using ⇵ button required check correct team serving (indicated white circle court diagram). text: click serve (point court ball) happens. video continue playing click reception location (ball touched receiver) point ball lands/hits net (untouched ace error). video automatically pause dialog pop allowing select receiving player serve outcome (serve error, ace, reception play). can also adjust serve type incorrect. cases isn’t clear point serve ace “reception play” (e.g. shanked pass players chasing , haven’t yet seen successful). case click “Reception play”. can adjusted “Ace” next step, necessary click reception location correctly, reason want go back try , click “Cancel rewind”. Otherwise click “Continue” video resume playing.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: click location set (second-contact action something else, setter tip. Remember point ground directly ball, ball ). video pause data entry dialog pop choose correct second-contact action (default “Set” can also set error, setter tip, second-ball attack, freeball . reception turned error (serve ace, second contact scout) can also select check pass quality. automatically given grade, situations might need override automatic assessment pass overpass, can assign appropriate opposition action (dig, dig error, overpass attack) player second contact default set, assigned setter court. comfortable scouting process, see second contact set setter, can hold shift clicking second contact. causes app enter set action (setter) automatically-assigned pass quality, without stopping video showing data entry dialog, makes part scouting faster. Similarly reception error, cases isn’t immediately clear set error (e.g. unhittable set, delayed double-contact call referee). Scout set (appropriate player) can converted set error next step necessary.

text: third contact commonly attack (can also freeball set error, play opposition overpass/overset. click contact location (remember point ground directly ball, ball ). video pause data entry dialog pop attack: enter attacking player either attack combination code (scouting combo codes) tempo optionally (recommended) enter number blockers attack Otherwise enter appropriate action player.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: attack freeball , click end point. scouting “actual” end convention (see Preferences) point ball lands, point court directly ball played. end convention “intended”, point attacker intended hit ball. Enter appropriate details. attack kill, dig dig error can also involve block touch — can recorded (see “block touch player …”). attack dug (.e. play continues) care scouting digs, can shift-click attack end point app record end point attack without showing popup dialog. faster, note dig scouted, block touch can entered.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Scouting now continues point ends, attacks, digs, contacts recorded. default, sets transition scouted (except set errors, since set error end rally). attack, record dig location straight counter-attack location, intervening set scouted. can choose include transition sets wish (see Preferences change behaviour) huge practical advantage . enable much terms analytics, takes extra time scout, transition sets disabled default.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: point can ended entering terminal action (kill error), point ends way doesn’t fit nicely available options, can pause video (press “q” pause button) choose “Won current rally” appropriate team.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: set concludes, prompt confirm whether end set. Confirm end set enter lineups next set ready start scouting one.

title: User manual - ovscout2
text: Pausing video (press “q” pause button) bring dialog allows enter timeout substitution, change setter court given team (e.g. team playing two-setter system, need change setter court time setters swap).

what: What’s the difference between a .ovs file and a .dvw file?
title: User manual - ovscout2
text: .ovs file format used internally app store match scouted. similar .dvw file, contains information .dvw file different format. save partially-scouted match come back later continue scouting, use .ovs file format. (can continue scouting partially-scouted file .dvw format, “undo” functionality limited). finished scouting match wish use match file analysis software (including openvolley R packages), export dvw format use .

title: An R Shiny App for Scouting Volleyball Match Files
text: R package provides Shiny app scouting volleyball data files. stage entirely experimental. Beware!

title: An R Shiny App for Scouting Volleyball Match Files
text: scouting always done video, even scouting live match. hope can make user interface fast enough “nearly real time” - scout might lag behind real action times, can catch ends rallies breaks play registering corners court scouting, can map court image real-world court space. Clicking location video can converted corresponding court coordinates. touch-screen device, click interface can reasonably fast scouting process avoids unnecessarily asking information (e.g. information can inferred means, player next serve), tries pre-fill much information can data entry step. learn team’s patterns play, can suggest likely player attacked, passed dug certain ball software intended scouts access professional scouting software aren’t proficient . alternative many available tablet- phone-based scouting apps, provides complete match data fully dvw compatible, (hope) easy use. unlikely replace professional scouting software used scouts can already capture match data real time.

text: guided scouting interface easy learn ensures consistent data collection interface can tailored simple advanced scouting, details latter contacts recorded precise locations (coordinates) well zones subzones experimental support dual match video cameras (one either end court)

what: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: Create new datavolley match object

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
code: dv_create(   match,   more,   teams,   players_h,   players_v,   video_file,   attacks = ov_simplified_attack_table(),   setter_calls = ov_default_setter_calls_table(),   winning_symbols = ov_default_winning_symbols(),   zones_or_cones = "Z",   regulation = "indoor rally point",   comments )

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: match list single-row data.frame: (optional) components date (defaults current date), time (defaults current time), season, league, phase, home_away, day_number, match_number, regulation, zones_or_cones. zones_or_cones can also provided directly list single-row data.frame: (optional) components referees, spectators, receipts, city, arena, scout teams data.frame: 2-row data frame, required columns team_id, team optional columns coach, assistant, shirt_colour players_h, players_v data.frame: required columns number, firstname, lastname, optional columns player_id, role (character vector "outside", "opposite", "middle", "libero", "setter"), nickname, special_role (character vector "L", "C", NA), foreign (logical, defaults FALSE) video_file string: (optional) path video file attacks data.frame: returned ov_simplified_attack_table() ov_default_attack_table() setter_calls data.frame: returned ov_default_setter_calls_table() winning_symbols data.frame: returned ov_default_winning_symbols() zones_or_cones string: "Z" "C". ignored zones_or_cones provided match parameter regulation string: "indoor rally point", "beach rally point", "indoor sideout". ignored regulation provided match parameter comments character: optional vector length 5, comments

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
text: datavolley object

title: Create a new datavolley match object — dv_create
code: x <- dv_create(teams = data.frame(team_id = c("TM1", "TM2"), team = c("Team 1", "Team 2")),                comments = "Test file",                players_h = data.frame(firstname = toupper(letters[1:7]), lastname = "Player",                                       number = 1:7),                players_v = data.frame(firstname = letters[10:15], lastname = "VisPlayer",                                       number = 10:15))  ## enter the team lineups for set 1 x <- dv_set_lineups(x, set_number = 1, lineups = list(6:1, 15:10), setter_positions = c(2, 1))

text: x datavolley: datavolley object set_number integer: set number, 1--3 beach 1--5 indoor lineups list: two-element list numeric vectors player numbers. lineup indoor, length 6, 7, 8 (first 6 player jersey numbers positions 1--6, elements 7 8 optionally libero jersey numbers) beach, length 2 setter_positions integer: two-element integer vector giving position court two setters. least one setter_positions setters must provided indoor. Ignored beach setters integer: two-element integer vector giving jersey numbers two setters. least one setter_positions setters must provided indoor. Ignored beach

what: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
text: Launch Shiny app scouting

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
code: ov_scouter(   dvw,   video_file,   court_ref,   season_dir,   auto_save_dir,   scoreboard = TRUE,   ball_path = FALSE,   review_pane = TRUE,   playlist_display_option = "dv_codes",   scouting_options = ov_scouting_options(),   shortcuts = ov_default_shortcuts(),   scout_name = "",   show_courtref = FALSE,   launch_browser = TRUE,   prompt_for_files = interactive(),   ... )

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
text: dvw string datavolley: either path dvw ovs file datavolley object (e.g. returned dv_create(). Passing file name (datavolley object) required extra arguments passed via .... dvw can also object saved ov_scouter() ovs format. dvw "demo", app started demonstration data set video_file string: optionally, path video file. supplied (NULL) video file specified dvw file used. video_file can also URL (including YouTube URL video ID). NOTE case, court_ref must provided, yet entered interactively app court_ref data.frame string: data.frame court reference (returned ovideo::ov_shiny_court_ref()) path rds file containing output season_dir string: optional path directory dvw/ovs files season auto_save_dir string: optional path directory dvw saved automatically rally scoreboard logical: TRUE, show scoreboard top-right video pane ball_path logical: TRUE, show ball path court inset diagram. Note slow app slightly review_pane logical: TRUE, entry popups accompanied small video pane shows loop video action question playlist_display_option string: show plays table? Either "dv_codes" (scouted codes) "commentary" (plain-language interpretation touches) scouting_options list: named list entries per ov_scouting_options() shortcuts list: named list keyboard shortcuts, returned ov_default_shortcuts() scout_name string: name scout (name) show_courtref logical: TRUE, show court reference lines overlaid video launch_browser logical: TRUE, launch app system's default web browser (passed shiny::runApp()'s launch.browser parameter) prompt_for_files logical: dvw specified, prompt user select dvw file ... : extra parameters passed datavolley::dv_read() (dvw provided string) /shiny server UI functions

title: Launch a Shiny app for scouting — ov_scouter
Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: Scouting options

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
code: ov_scouting_options(   end_convention = "actual",   nblockers = TRUE,   default_nblockers = NA,   transition_sets = FALSE,   attacks_by = "codes",   team_system = "SHM3",   setter_dump_code = "PP",   second_ball_attack_code = "P2",   overpass_attack_code = "PR",   default_scouting_table = ov_default_scouting_table(),   compound_table = ov_default_compound_table() )

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: end_convention string: either "actual" "intended". end coordinate attack serve actual end location (ball contacted floor bounds area), intended one. actual might differ intended block touch ball hit net. "actual", block touch recorded, end location attack used dig location (dig location missing) nblockers logical: scout number blockers attack? default_nblockers integer: nblockers TRUE, number blockers default ? NA, default transition_sets logical: scout sets transition? FALSE, just endpoint attack (.e. dig) subsequent counter-attack scouted attacks_by string: "codes" (X5, V5, etc) "tempo" (high, medium, quick) team_system string: assumed system teams using assign e.g. passing hitting responsibilities "SHM3" - setter-hitter-middle rotation, 3 passers (libero two outside hitters) setter_dump_code string: attack combination code setter dump second_ball_attack_code string: attack combination code second-ball attack overpass_attack_code string: attack combination code attack overpass default_scouting_table tibble: table scouting defaults (skill type evaluation) compound_table tibble: table compound codes

title: Scouting options — ov_scouting_options
text: named list

title: ovscout2 — ovscout2
text: Functions scouting volleyball match files.
